title: The Hellbound
synopsis:
Indiscriminately and without warning, numerous people around the world receive foreboding news. Contained in a harrowing three-part message are: the name of the recipient, the fact they are doomed to Hell, and the exact amount of time they have left on Earth. There is no use running, and no one will answer their pleas for salvation. For these people, their fate is certain—a public demonstration in which primordial beings will brutalize the victim and leave behind nothing but a hollowed-out husk.

According to an emerging religious organization, these are acts of God, who is condemning sinners to where they belong. The leader of the religious group is a young man named Jeong Jinsu, who entreats the populace to live righteously and without evil to avoid such a fate. Dubious of these supernatural claims, the police in Seoul assign the detective Jin Gyeonghun to investigate the recent death of a man, which is being attributed to this phenomenon. As he grapples with his own grievances over the release of his wife's murderer, Detective Jin begins to unravel the truth behind the organization's leader and the phenomena of those bound for Hell.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]
background: The Hellbound is based on Yeon Sang-ho's animated film Jiok. It is originally a webtoon series which was officially published in book format by Munhak Dongne (문학동네) from July 3, 2020 to January 6, 2021. It was adapted to a 6 episode live action TV series, which released on Netflix on November 19, 2021. The series was published digitally in English as Hellbound by LINE Manga from November 15, 2021 to November 21, 2022, and was published in print as The Hellbound by Dark Horse from March 2, 2022 to July 20, 2022.
